item.title: Oil Prices Lift With Investors Nervous Over Israel-Gaza
item.description: Oil prices were slightly firmer, as worries lingered over the current situation in Israel and Gaza.

item.title: UK Jobless Rate Holds Steady
item.description: The unemployment rate was unchanged in the three months to August at 4.2%, a further signal of the U.K.’s stubbornly robust labor market that could continue to cause problems for the BOE.

item.title: Euro Could Rise Further Against Weaker Dollar in Near-Term
item.description: The euro could extend gains against a weak dollar in the near term, Danske Bank Research said, as the dollar dropped to one-month lows due to falling Treasury yields.

item.title: Novartis Lifts Guidance Again
item.description: Novartis said it now expects core profit in the year to grow by a percentage in the mid to high teens range after it reported a 21% rise in core earnings in the third quarter, boosted by strong sale of key drugs.

item.title: Barclays Trims U.K. Net Interest Margin View
item.description: Barclays said it expects net interest margin for the U.K. of 3.05%-3.1% in 2023, as it posted lower-than-expected third-quarter income growth.

item.title: Green Steel Is Coming. Europe Is Leading the Charge Thanks to New Carbon Taxes.
item.description: By 2030, the continent is expected to be home to nearly 50 low-carbon steel projects, while just two are planned in the U.S.

item.title: Eurozone Bond Yields Decline Ahead of PMI Data
item.description: Eurozone government bond yields fell in early European trade, tracking lower Treasury yields, as investors await the latest PMI data.

item.title: Puma Backs Outlook Despite Weaker Profits
item.description: Puma confirmed its 2023 guidance even though its underlying earnings fell by 8.3% in the third quarter, hit by currency effects.

item.title: Barclays Lowered Margin Guidance Seems Set to Disappoint
item.description: Barclays shares fell 7% to their lowest since March, after the lender downgraded its 2023 net interest margin guidance for its U.K. division.

item.title: No Recovery Seen in German Consumer Mood This Year
item.description: Germany’s forward-looking consumer-sentiment index forecast confidence to fall to minus 28.1 in November, weakening for a third consecutive month, with GfK and NIM saying “hopes of a recovery…this year must finally be laid to rest.”

item.title: UniCredit Upgrades Guidance After Third-Quarter Beat
item.description: UniCredit raised its 2023 outlook for net interest income and revenue, after its third-quarter results came in above forecast, and said it expected to pay shareholders at least €6.5 billion for 2024.

item.title: Orange Keeps Outlook After Solid Third Quarter
item.description: Orange confirmed its 2023 guidance after it reported earnings for the third quarter that edged consensus expectations.

item.title: Energy Shocks to Hasten Move to Renewables, IEA Says
item.description: Global demand for fossil fuels is likely to peak before the end of the decade, with mounting shocks to the global energy system caused by geopolitical uncertainty hastening the move to renewable energy, the IEA said.

item.title: How Far Is China's Slowdown Spreading? Ask a Dairy Farmer 6,000 Miles Away
item.description: Weak demand among Chinese consumers for milk is rippling out to the rolling hills of New Zealand.

item.title: The Justice Department has requested more information from Tesla as it investigates the electric-car maker's autopilot technology.
item.description: The Justice Department has requested more information from Tesla as it investigates the electric-car maker’s autopilot technology.

item.title: A Russian court formally arrested a U.S. journalist for Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty in a case that is exacerbating tensions between Washington and Moscow.
item.description: A Russian court formally arrested a U.S. journalist for Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty in a case that is exacerbating tensions between Washington and Moscow.

item.title: Republican candidates for House speaker pitched their strategies to colleagues ahead of a vote scheduled for Tuesday to designate a new party nominee.
item.description: Republican candidates for House speaker pitched their strategies to colleagues ahead of a vote scheduled for Tuesday to designate a new party nominee.

item.title: Argentine stocks, bonds and currency traded sharply lower after the ruling party's presidential candidate came out on top in the first voting round.
item.description: Argentine stocks, bonds and currency traded sharply lower after the ruling party’s presidential candidate came out on top in the first voting round.

item.title: A deepening selloff in the U.S. bond market drove the yield on the 10-year U.S. Treasury note to 5% for the first time in 16 years, a milestone that has rattled stocks, lifted mortgage rates and fueled fears of an economic slowdown.
item.description: A deepening selloff in the U.S. bond market drove the yield on the 10-year U.S. Treasury note to 5% for the first time in 16 years, a milestone that has rattled stocks, lifted mortgage rates and fueled fears of an economic slowdown.

item.title: The Biden administration is proposing major changes to the H-1B visa program for high-skilled foreign professionals, after a finding that companies had colluded to try to increase their chances of winning a visa.
item.description: The Biden administration is proposing major changes to the H-1B visa program for high-skilled foreign professionals, after a finding that companies had colluded to try to increase their chances of winning a visa.
